pages.text: The power of the $(t:...Patent Pending)$(5)$(italic)$(bold)Static Industries I/O Port $(reset)provides all machines with the ability to configure their interfacing behaviour on each side! This means you can configure machines to auto $(6)$(bold)output $(reset)items on one side, $(9)$(bold)input $(reset)fluids on another, and $(4)$(bold)disable $(reset)any interaction on all other sides.
$(8)A squeezer $(9)$(bold)inputing $(reset)$(8)on the top and $(6)$(bold)outputing $(reset)$(8)on the left.

pages.title: I/O Port Servo
pages.text: Most machines that offer side configuration have built in servos to handle the transaction of items/fluids/power. This means that placing a machine adjacent to a chest and configuring that side of the machine to $(9)$(bold)input $(reset)will cause the machine to start pulling items from the chest. Similarly, if the machine side was set to $(6)$(bold)output, $(reset)the machine would output its product into that chest.

pages.title: Power
pages.text: The side configurations for power are elementary! There are only three options: $(9)$(bold)input, $(6)$(bold)output, $(reset)and $(4)$(bold)disabled. $(reset)Only batteries and other power generating machines can have their sides configured for power. All other machines accept power on all sides and do not offer the opportunty to provide power.

pages.title: Items
pages.text: The side configurations for items are more complex but also, more powerful! A machine can have up to 8 options: $(9)$(bold)input, $(d)$(bold)secondary input, $(5)$(bold)tertiary input, $(6)$(bold)output, $(2)$(bold)secondary output, $(#c4be00)$(bold)tertiary output, $(b)$(bold)quaternary output, $(reset)and $(4)$(bold)disabled. $(reset)The role these configurions play can differ from machine to machine, although the majority only offer the primary 3 $(bold)$(9)op$(6)ti$(4)ons.

pages.title: Fluids
pages.text: The side configurations for fluids provide the same options as the configurations for items, except they interact with fluids.
